name: Vegan Peanut Sauce
description: Vegan Peanut Sauce is ready in just 5 minutes with a handful of pantry staples you probably have on hand right now! It can be used as a dipping sauce, salad dressing, in noodle dishes or drizzled on buddha bowls.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce (use tamari for gluten free)
1/3 cup pure maple syrup OR agave
1/4 teaspoons ground ginger (or 2 teaspoons fresh grated ginger)
2-6 tablespoons unsweetened coconut milk, as needed (SEE NOTE)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium sized bowl, whisk all the ingredients together until smooth. Start with just 2 tablespoons of coconut milk, and add more as needed to thin the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium sized bowl, whisk all the ingredients together until smooth. Start with just 2 tablespoons of coconut milk, and add more as needed to thin the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: If serving as a dip, sprinkle with crushed peanuts. The sauce also goes well with noodles, buddha bowls, fresh spring rolls, tofu and salads.
recipeInstructions.name: If serving as a dip, sprinkle with crushed peanuts. The sauce also goes well with noodles, buddha bowls, fresh spring rolls, tofu and salads.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. It can also be frozen in a freezer safe container.
recipeInstructions.name: Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. It can also be frozen in a freezer safe container.

keywords: asian peanut sauce, thai peanut sauce, vegan peanut sauce
